title: Scarlet Macaw
description: A vibrant parrot native to Central and South American rainforests, known for its bright red, yellow, and blue feathers.

title: Toucan
description: Recognizable by its large, colorful bill, the toucan is a social bird native to tropical forests in Central and South America.

title: Blue-and-yellow Macaw
description: A striking parrot species with blue and yellow plumage, often found in forested regions of South America.

title: Keel-billed Toucan
description: Known for its large, colorful bill, this toucan species is found in Central and South American tropical forests.

title: African Grey Parrot
description: A highly intelligent parrot with exceptional mimicry abilities, native to the rainforests of West and Central Africa.

title: Green-winged Macaw
description: One of the largest macaw species, this bird is distinguished by its red, green, and blue feathers.

title: Resplendent Quetzal
description: A vibrantly colored bird with long tail feathers, native to Central America's cloud forests.

title: Greater Bird-of-paradise
description: Known for its stunning plumage and elaborate courtship displays, this bird is native to New Guinea's forests.

title: Rainbow Lorikeet
description: A colorful parrot species with vibrant green, red, blue, and yellow plumage, native to Australia and New Guinea.

title: Sun Conure
description: A small parrot known for its bright yellow and orange feathers, found in the tropical forests of South America.

title: Red-eyed Tree Frog
description: A small, brightly colored frog with red eyes and blue and yellow side stripes, found in Central American rainforests.

title: Poison Dart Frog
description: A group of brightly colored, highly toxic frogs found in the tropical rainforests of Central and South America.

title: Glass Frog
description: Known for its translucent skin, this frog allows internal organs to be partially visible, native to Central and South America.

title: Amazon Milk Frog
description: Named for the milky secretion it produces, this frog is native to the Amazon Rainforest and has a unique blue-grey color.

title: Golden Poison Frog
description: One of the most toxic animals on Earth, this small frog is native to Colombia's Pacific coast.

title: Strawberry Poison Dart Frog
description: A small, bright red frog found in Central America, it has a variety of color morphs and is mildly toxic.

title: Blue Poison Dart Frog
description: A brightly colored blue frog, native to Suriname and parts of Brazil, known for its skin toxins.

title: Waxy Monkey Tree Frog
description: An arboreal frog with waxy skin that helps retain moisture, native to South American dry forests.

title: Tomato Frog
description: A bright red frog native to Madagascar, known for secreting a sticky substance to deter predators.

title: Splendid Leaf Frog
description: An arboreal frog with vibrant green and orange markings, found in Central America's rainforests.
